text:
DEVI SHETTY: I never
thought that, one day,

I will raise money from
private equity company
to grow the business.
I come from a business family.

And very early
stage of my life, I

realized that charity
is not scalable.

Good business
principles are scalable.

And the second most
important lesson

I learned in the
formative years is

that money is like oxygen. Your
purpose of life is not oxygen.

But without oxygen,
you don't even

survive for more
than three minutes.

So I realized that
money is important.

And I raised money
through private equity.

It was mostly a
happy experience.

But obviously,
they're investors.
They want return on investment.

I never thought that I will
list my company in stock market.

Because my vision was
to create something

which gives me the total
independence to do whatever
I wanted.

I did go through a
lot of introspection.

I realized that I
had either choose

to remain as a small player with
all the independence of what

I wanted to do or
lease the company

and run the company in a manner
that the shareholders will

agree with whatever
you want to do.
So it was a big, big risk.

Because nobody in my family
ever listed their company.

So it was a big
transition for me.

But fortunately, I
looked at the future.

Because I am blessed
with four wonderful kids.

And I realized that we have
to build something big.
So I took the dive.
And no regrets since then.
